title: The Divine Pastimes of Srivasa Thakura | Sri Gaura Mandala Parikrama 2024 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.summary: The lecture begins with repeated chanting of Sri Gauranga.

segments.key_quote: If by scholarship one does not gain such devotion, then how will that learning help him?
segments.summary: Srivas Thakur, considered an incarnation of Narada Muni, emphasizes the importance of devotion over mere scholarship, advising a young Nimai Pandit to worship Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Without the blessings and guidance of great souls and without the prayers of great Vaishnavas, beseeching Krishna to extend his mercy to us, there is no hope of our really receiving the mercy of Krishna.
segments.summary: Mahaprabhu's initiation by Eswara Puri demonstrates the necessity of a guru and the mercy of Vaishnavas for attaining Krishna's grace.

segments.key_quote: He loves me so much that he does not even express his gratitude. He does not even express his grief over the death of his own son.
segments.summary: The story of Srivas Thakur's son's death during kirtan highlights his extraordinary detachment and devotion to Lord Chaitanya, leading to a benediction of prosperity.

segments.key_quote: Śrīvās is Nārada who plays such an important part in Kṛṣṇa's līlā.
segments.summary: The lecture concludes with information about ISKCON's service at Srivas Pandit's birthplace, an ancient temple, and a mantra describing Srivas Thakur's lineage and associates.
